The Night Cafe: A VR Tribute to Vincent Van Gogh is a Free small VR experience.  It worked on my system, looked ok, played ok, sounded ok.  

Try it, you might like it.

For more info:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8B1nBEsGUNM

http://www.virtualrealityreviewer.com/DEMO-detail/the-night-cafe-a-vr-tribute-to-vincent-van-gogh/

39347023.review: Very surreal and trippy.  This one is a fan favourite for certain types when demoing VR...

38072353.review:
This experience was a serious disappointment.  I put on my headset and found myself in one of Van Goh's masterpieces. I looked around and explored, it was great. But then, came the disappointment. I saw a man staring out the window, he had red hair and I thought, "That looks like Van Goh." I tried to make my way out the window or out the door so I could see his face. Well, he obliged me and turned around.  It was him!  He moved over to a chair and sat down.  It was him. I wanted to introduce myself, say hello, or tell him how much I love his work.

But, it was a simulation. I couldn't talk to him.  Disappointment.  Still, it was an awesome experience, and I recommend it to everyone who loves Van Gogh, and those who don't. Maybe you'll love him after this.

37855791.review:
[h1]Played On: [b]HTC Vive[/b][/h1]

The Night Cafe is a very short experience that revolves around the famed painter, Vincent Van Gogh. As the name might suggest, you wander around a small cafe at night, but you get to enjoy the company of Vincent himself. The small tavern has five explorable rooms, though the only alloted controls are for movement; sadly, you are unable to pick up any objects, or interact with anything.

The game came out in June 2016, just a couple months after both the HTC Vive and Oculus Rift launched on the consumer market, so its lack of interactive depth is forgivable in a nomadic extent. Regardless, the game is highly detailed and incredibly beautiful, being complimented right down to the brush strokes that Van Gogh was so well known for using. A few of his artworks are represented, such as his self-portrait, the famous chair, and even Starry Night if you can manage to lean out of the cafe window far enough.

Even though it is incredibly short, coming in at around 10 minutes or less, The Night Cafe is an experience that must be had by all fans, like myself, of Vincent Van Gogh. He still stands as one of the most widely recognized painters of all time, and seeing his work brought to life in VR is incredible. An modernized update to this title would be well received if the developer decided to add interactivity, and maybe a few nods to Van Gogh's more obscure works as well. Either way, it's free, and it's every art-appreciator's dream to wander in what is basically a gigantic piece of artwork from one of their favorite artists.  

[h1]Rating: [b]4.0/5.0[/b] - Excellent, highly worth playing.[/h1]
The Virtual Reality Network [url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/31311814/]Curator[/url] | [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/thevirtualrealitynetwork]Group[/url] Click for More

36309650.review: Walk around inside a Van Gogh painting, what's not to love?

35784956.review:
Este jogo foi a minha primeira experiência com um óculos de realidade virtual (HTC Vive) e fico muito feliz de tê-lo escolhido, pois minhas lembranças dele serão eternas; eu amei demais a experiência. Quem diria que um dia alguém poderia entrar dentro de uma pintura! 
Estava tensa e ansiosa, porém, pois era uma experiência totalmente nova pra mim.

Foi surreal para mim ver pessoas feitas de tinta, objetos feitos de tinta... tudo ao meu redor feito de tinta. Caminhei até o pianista, ouvindo a música aumentar de volume gradativamente... observei-o tocando e senti uma paz muito grande, realmente gostei muito daquela sensação. Olhei para o lado e para minha surpresa, lá estava o próprio Van Gogh! O que será que ele pensaria se pudesse experienciar estar dentro da sua própria obra de arte?

O Van Gogh se levantou e caminhou até a janela, observou o céu e sentou-se novamente. Eu fiquei ali parada, boquiaberta, observando tudo com uma enorme admiração. Caminhei até a janela também, pude ver do lado de fora... senti medo, não sei porquê mas estava com medo... creio que meu cérebro estranhou estar num mundo feito de tinta, tudo tão colorido e surreal!

Depois disso observei a moça sentada à mesa, o senhor perto da mesa de bilhar, achei engraçado pois ele era bem mais baixo que eu. Andei para perto da escada mas não quis descer pois estava escuro lá embaixo kkkkkkk Observei as lâmpadas, onde a luz de tinta brilhava hipnotizantemente... 

Enfim, foi uma experiência sem igual. Espero muito poder visitar outras obras de arte no futuro! Guardarei para sempre The Night Cafe em meu coração.

30921982.review:
I really liked The Night Cafe.

I would say that a knowledge of Van Gogh's paintings is helpful to enjoy some surprises in the experience, though. Make sure you take a peek out the window next to the piano for a glimpse of Starry Night, or head down into the basement to enjoy the dedication letter.

It's short, but someone put a lot of love and effort into bringing Van Gogh's world to life. It's worth spending a few minutes inside and sharing that experience. Pull up a chair, sit next to Van Gogh, and listen to the piano.

29592783.review:
One of the best free VR experiences out there. Essentially a house-sized moving art piece. I highly recommend grabbing a wooden chair, setting it up where one of the chairs are in the virtual space, taking a seat and enjoying the views (once you're done exploring everywhere). It's incredibly immersive and relaxing.

I just wish it had cost a couple bucks so I could support the developers. Thanks for the awesome content! I'll be keeping an eye on all your future projects.

25860642.review: Es una buena aplicación para introducir a la gente en la realidad virtual de la mano de Van Gogh y demostrar las cosas que se pueden hacer. Con música agradable convierte la experiencia en positiva cuando simplemente se busque observar dentro del espacio recreado por los desarrolladores sin mas interacciones que es el desplazamiento con la función de teleportarse para poder ver todo el interior de la casa donde se desarrolla el escenario y poder asomarse por las ventanas y disfrutar de un cielo también dibujado al estilo Van Gogh. Tenemos varios individuos dentro del escenario incluyendo a Van Gogh, un pianista y una señora haciendo ganchillo aparte de nosotros mismos que es lo interesante de la realidad virtual pues puedes ser uno mas de los personajes que componen la escena.

24020734.review:
Really nice experience that I recommend to all Vive Owners. I loved to be able to see all the little details of the painting, specially when you look out of the window and gaze towards the sky. A good choice of music enhanced the whole scene.

I would certainly use this for demoing the Vive to non gamers, so they can see how virtual reality can be used for  many purposes, like learning and helping people approach the universe of an artist. My only nitpick is that sometimes you don't know if you can acces the area behind a closed door, even when you are in front of it, and the basement seems glitchy from a distance (though maybe that was intended to hide the little easter egg downstairs).

23976368.review: One of these best experiences I've had with the Vive so far. This is not a game but a virtual experience. The vibrant colors and  slight motions are stimulating. You find yourself drawn into trying to talk to and inspect the characters. If you haven't tried this yet, let it be one of your first priorities.

23950780.review: The Night Cafe is as beautiful as it is short. I don't know anything about Van Gogh or the piece that inspired this experience. You get to poke around a bar with a billard table. One room over is Van Gogh (I guess?) enjoying his pipe and some very, very haunting music. All of it looks gorgeous. I was surprised by how well this worked with the polygonal, moving characters. There's also a very touching tribute to someone in the experience. I won't say where it is, but you should make sure you find it. Juxtaposed against the melancholic music, it had a profoundly "Gone Home" vibe to it that hit me pretty hard.

Nifty concept, terrible stability.

23738239.review:
very good . ★★★★★☆

後期印象派の天才画家・[url=https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E3%83%95%E3%82%A3%E3%83%B3%E3%82%BB%E3%83%B3%E3%83%88%E3%83%BB%E3%83%95%E3%82%A1%E3%83%B3%E3%83%BB%E3%82%B4%E3%83%83%E3%83%9B]フィンセント・ファン・ゴッホ[/url]
の世界を[b]ＶＲ[/b]で楽しむという作品。
鳥肌ものです。美術の飛躍といえましょう。
ＮＹで見たビデオアートとは比べ物にならないです。
平面ディスプレイでのプレイでしたが、ＶＲで楽しみたいものです。

美術館に足を運んでゴッホの絵画を鑑賞した帰りに、
売店で”３Ｄ絵画のメガネ”を買ったものです。


まず、先に残念な点を書きます。
移動による引っかかりがありストレスがたまる。
油絵の宝石のような透明感や凸凹のディテールが表現できてないです。

あと気になったのは数日前に見たときは、
チョコレート１ダース分の価格で販売されてたのに、
無料になってました。僕の何かの見間違いだろうか？

この作品は、ゲームというより[u]アート鑑賞[/u]に近いでしょう。
ゴッホを知らない人でも楽しめれるでしょうし、
ゴッホが好きな人は良質なＢＧＭを聞きながらじっくりとひたれるでしょう。


[h1]＜世界観＞[/h1]
[b]時計の針は１時１０分をさしている。
目の前にビリヤード台。その横に年配の紳士的な男性がたっている。
周りのデーブルには、空いたビンやコップが置かれている。
椅子は不規則に。端角の席に中年ぐらいの女性が座っている。
隣の部屋では、ピアノを弾くピアニスト。
その後ろには、若きころのゴッホがくつろいでいる。
ゴッホの目線の先には、ひまわりが。

しゃがんで窓の外を見ると月明かりが。
ほとんどの客が帰った、深夜なのだろう。

壁窓をのぞくと絵画が見える。
これは、セザンヌの絵画？
色調が暗い。

廊下には、ゴッホが愛用した椅子が。

そのまま地下に降りると、一本のひまわりと一本の蝋燭の火、そしてメモが。[/b]

 [spoiler]There is no blue without yellow and without orange
                              　　　　　　　　　　                       -vincent van Gogh-

 In memory of Azariah Jones[/spoiler]




http://store.steampowered.com/app/482390

23720128.review: An amazing game with beond wonderful artwork I would highly recormend this game to any art lovers.

23718928.review:
So awesome.  If you like traditional painting art work then this is a must try.  Feels like Van Gogh painting come to life and you can move around in it and see from all angles.  The detail that they created with this experience is amazing.
I did it on Vive and it allows roomscale walking around and you can teleport around to see not just one single painting, but the whole cafe with a few rooms.  It's not just a still life, but the painting is alive with moving characters.
Bravisimo or whatever means f'in awesome.
Will keep this to show off to anyone that I show VR to.

23673605.review:
Magnifique moment, on rêve d'un musée entier à visiter, une immersion dans un tableau, dans l'univers d'un artiste. Les couleurs,  les animations et le côté irréel de l'expérience vous emportent ailleurs, dans l'univers de Van Gogh. Magique.
A télécharger absolument et à faire découvrir aux plus cultivés de vos amis.

23657868.review: (HTC Vive Room-Scale perspective...)   It's like being inside a Van Gogh painting--strange and beautiful.  Really a neat idea.  (The music enahnces nicely.)

23566037.review: One of the best VR experiences I've had! Marvelous creation!

23542264.review: A fine demonstration of the capabilities of VR and the difficult task we face in conveying the experience. It is something that must be seen to be understood. There is a vast scope of possibilities for 3D galleries and exhibits with VR.

23517530.review:
Seeing a 2D painting is a thing, but actually being in Van Gogh's painting is a breathtaking experience, that I bumped in to the wall twice.
With suiting piano playing, basement that has Van Gogh's letter, you can even use the toilet* for free in The Night's Cafe!

*No pun intended

23511999.review: This is a wonderful little VR experience, perfect for showing off your fancy new tech to VRgins and non-gamers. If you like Vinnie, as I call him, this will be a treat. As others have said, it's short, sweet, and free. You will find yourself actually in that little cafe, hanging out with Vinnie and his sunflowers and his starry night. Not that the characters really do much, but they do have some idle animations, so they're not just statue-paintings. The dev(s) really did a great job of capturing his artwork and putting you inside of it. I wanted so badly to go out on the streets and explore. One day, perhaps.

23479878.review:
VERY cool experience
if youre into art or like van gogh, try it
only 5-10mins but very well done

23478202.review: Reviewed on the Vive.  A wonderful experience well worth the time to check it out. When I went into the room where Vincent is sitting, smoking his pipe, I was vaping my e-pipe with him and it was an amazing connection. He in his chair and I standing next to him, contemplatively smoking/vaping whilst listening to the piano player. An amazing moment of presence. Then I walked to the right and stuck my head out the window and looked up. Man, I just teared up. I had to lift my headset and let the tears run out.  One of my favorite easter eggs ever. Thank you, devs. that was brilliant!!

23476223.review: My wife loves the art of Van Gogh, and loved this tribute. She said it is really faithfull to the brushstrokes pallete and atmosfere of this pieces.

23473177.review: Loved this on the vive - colourful and amazing to explore!  Found it a little tricky to get around certain areas (is it possible to go outside?). The haptic feedback on navigation was a bit much - just a little upon teleport might be better.  Awesome work, and great to see these paintings come to life!

23468796.review:
Truely a tribute to Van Gogh.

A beautiful simulation, a great idea. Lets me hope for more.

Looking forward to Dali, Monet and Picasso ;)

23460874.review: I downloaded it for my Oculus Rift and was unable to move.   At all.  It looks like it would be cool, but it's hard to recommend when the current experience is basically standing in one place and looking around a room.  Lots of promise, but not for the Rift yet, apparently.
23460874.developer_response:
Hi augieray,

The Night Cafe supports  both Rift and Vive but in order to access the Rift version you have to make sure to launch it from the Steam client and use the option "Play using Rift headset" when prompted. If you launch it from a desktop shortcut you won't see this option. It sounds like you are accessing the Vive version with your Rift.

Best,
BLS

23460164.review: It's just amazing.  What a relaxing way to unwind.  I would gladly pay for more artwork exploration.  Well done.

23450198.review:
[i]Played on DK2 (Runtime 1.3)[/i]

[b]Nice little Gem,[/b]

I totally recommend this to every VR User. A new and innovative Way to bring classic Artworks closer to a broader public Audience. I would gladly spend Money for an Experience like that, if it would offer a lot more (and diverse) Artists and their Works. This little Teaser is free anyway, so there´s nothing to regret. The Experience isn´t very long and because of that i will bascially review through some short Pro/ Con Points.

[b]Pro:[/b]
New and fresh Experience
Bit of an 'Edutainment' Effect
Chill Factor
Free of Charge

[b]Con:[/b]
Short Experience
Unintuitive Movement and Controller Settings
Motion Sickness Factor
Not the whole Picture of VvG implemented (org. Artwork vs 3D Environment)


A bit of further Explanation regarding to the Cons. The 'Playtime' surely can vary from User to User but let´s say it this way: If you would rush through the Room you would have seen everything in less than a Minute but the Atmosphere is great and it sucks you in the Van Gogh World, so you may spend some more time in it. 

The Controller Settings are at least arkward. You can´t move 360 with the Sticks of the Gamepad but instead you have to use a Mix out of Sticks and digital Shoulder Buttons, which are turning the Camera for 45°. Felt not very intuitive to me.

For the Motion Sickness: I´ve played 1000s of hours with my DK2, mostly Elite, Project Cars and 'seated' Games and i would say that i have a good Resistance against MS (played Stuff like Dying Light or Alien Isolation in VR) but this makes me (a bit) sick if i am moving too much or to fast. It´s the old 'Moving as a Person in FPS' vs 'Sitting in a Car/ Cockpit' etc...



However, i wanna see more of Stuff like that. A full 'Game' so to speak. More Artists, from all Epoches and a more accurate Implementation of 'all' the Details of the Artwork. (The implemented Details at the NC TtVvG are to few, compared original Picture vs Ingame Scene) A 'full' Experience could have DLCs over and over btw. On top i wish for more 'Edutainment'. More Details depending on the Artists and their Lifes and Works, maybe some Sheets, Lists, Data, Timeline, etc.


All in all a good [b]8/10[/b], recommended! 
It´s free anyway, so no way to hesitate.

23443418.review: Excellent experience that will open your mind to the possibilities of VR.

23435971.review: Very good experience. It makes you steps inside one of Van Gogh's paintings, or, if you will, lets you see the world through his eyes, and it is quite convincing at that. Beautiful graphics and atmosphere. Only problem is I want more of it.

23423699.review: A meditation on loneliest and longing amongst such color and beauty. thank you

23407888.review: A simple idea, well executed. The only problems I had was firstly when I initially tried to run it directly from the store, it didn't recognise the rift controller. Secondly, I got stuck on the the toilet doorframe and had to quit.

23395874.review: What an experience. If I can bring a book in the cafe, guess I can just sit in there with Mr.Van Gogh for a whole lovely night.

23394375.review:
[h1]게임이라기보다는 3D 입체영상 체험기[/h1]

반 고흐를 주제한 게임이라고 나왔지만
게임이라기보다는 VR 고글을 쓰고 고흐풍의 그래픽의 입체영상을 감상하라는 의도가 강한 일종의 체험기같은거라고 할수 있다.

게임의 목적이나 퀘스트같은건 전혀 없고 그냥 여기저기를 돌아다니면서 배경 그래픽 감상하는 수준의 게임? 그런것이다.
잠시 설치해서 감상하면 좋지만 고글이 없다면 그렇게 큰 감동(?)은 받기 어려울듯하다.

그냥 이런게 있구나 생각하고 잠시 접속했다가 넘기는 수준의 게임.



평점 70점. (봐줄만하긴하지만 엄청 뛰어난 수준은 아니므로...)

23393325.review:
游戏内容：
免费游戏，400M+安装文件，向梵高致敬之作。
两分钟的VR体验，场景展示，以《夜间咖啡馆》为中心，将梵高的几幅作品嵌入场景，呈现给体验者。分辨率1024*768。游戏没有互动元素。BGM钢琴曲舒缓优美。

游戏操作：
支持键盘和手柄输入，WASD或方向键（手柄左摇杆）移动，鼠标移动（键盘十字架和肩键）左右旋转视角，C键（手柄A键）蹲下站起，空格键显示FPS等设备画面信息，手柄窗口键是唤出什么VIEW模式（图太小字看不清）。
没有VR设备的玩家打开游戏选第二项“玩 with Oculus Rift headset”，可以玩。如果选第一项“在Steam虚拟现实模式下启动 Only for HTC Vive”会黑屏，没有画面。

游戏名 The Night Café：
梵高画作《夜晚的咖啡馆\夜间咖啡馆》（The Night Cafe in the Place Lamartine in Arles）。
梵高自1888年5月到9月借住的兰卡散尔咖啡馆， 位于法国阿尔勒的形式广场(Place du Form), 由于通宵营业， 因而被称之为“夜间的咖啡馆”。

游戏中的场景截图与梵高画作对比：
寻找梵高——游戏中的梵高画作
https://www.keylol.com/article/ERIVR/3

23392300.review:
This is something special. 

I played this on the HTC Vive, and I felt so relaxed in this "painting" I wanted to sit there and listen to the piano player play and look at the Starry Night.

If I could change one thing though, it would be with the positional audio. You'll see what I mean.

Other than that, 10/10. Show your friends.

23390975.review:
Great to see this game on steam but this felt a lot different from when I first played it on the gearVR. In gearVR you have a touch button that allows you to walk forward but on steam you warp around the room and it really breaks immersion. Its amazing to be able to crouch and look around things on the vive but warpping really takes you out of the experience by breaking the continuity. Also, a custom controller other than the standard vive one would be great.

Otherwise, I love it!!!

23389971.review: Absolutely beautiful passion project in honor of Van Gogh. There were tears. Short and free, worth the download.

23388471.review: Testé sur HTC Vive. Je ne m'attendais pas à ça...... absolument magnifique. Merci, merci, merci 1000 fois !

23388448.review: Wow. This artistic experience is truly great. It perfectly achieves what it intended to create. If Van Gogh could have done a "VR painting", it really migh have looked like this experience.

23382802.review:
What a beautiful experience.

Also, an excellent introduction to VR for your friends and family who are non-gamers.

23381878.review: Beautiful, free.  Give it a try.

23381516.review: This is absolutely mind blowing. I'm not much for museums but if art was presented to me in this way I would likely never forget any of it, and explore every available square inch possible. This is also something even my parents, who don't game at all, can enjoy fully!

23380024.review:
This is a great little experience - a very imaginitive way to explore a painting.

My one suggestion to make the experience better would be to make the piano music simply stereo, and not positional. Either that or somehow make the sound so it is physically based and bounces around the room more. It felt distracting just coming out of one ear if I was facing perpendicular to the piano player. I suppose you could fake physically based audio by simply placing a few lower volume sound sources around at various places.

But thanks for making this! It's better than a lot of paid experiences out there.

23379043.review:
思ったよりも見て回れる？

自分の立ち位置でピアノの聞こえてくる方向がちゃんと変わるとか、移動する人物がいたり、それなりに作り込まれている。
地下もほぼ何もないけど移動可能。
アイテムをつかめたりするとよかったかな？

23377780.review: This is so relaxing and beautiful. Thanks for making it!

23374835.review:
Very moving.  Yet another "wow" Vive experience for me.  If you have any appreciation for art then this free title is absolutely worth spending some time with.  

As the title says, it is a tribute to artist Vincent Van Gogh and I'd liken it to the fabulous Studio Ghibli (My Neighbor Totoro) tribute that was made by "Fire Panda" (unfortunately that one has since been pulled by copywright owners).

I am going to put this on my 'come check out the Vive' rotation for friends and family that are curious but not necessarily technology enthusiasts.

Thank you to the author for spending the time to make this, and thank you Valve for keeping your development platform open and accessible.

23372411.review: Quite enjoyed the experience, well done. I love things that not necessarily games but more so short little experiences that put you in a different world for a short bit of time.

23371913.review:
《The Night Cafe》是一段纪念梵高的漫游VR片段，身临其境，通过虚拟现实的视角向大家展示梵高名画《夜晚的咖啡馆》，并以此来怀念这位著名的艺术家。

《夜晚的咖啡馆》是由深绿色的天花板、血红的墙壁和不和谐的绿色家具组成的梦魇。金灿灿的黄色地板呈纵向透视，以难以置信的力量进入到红色背景之中，反过来，红色背景也用均等的力量与之抗衡。这幅画，是透视空间和企图破坏这个空间的逼人色彩之间的永不调和的斗争。结果是一种幽闭、恐怖和压迫感的可怕体验。作品预示了超现实主义用透视作为幻想表现手段的探索，但是没有一种探索，能有如此震撼人心的力量。
 
这段对于《夜晚的咖啡馆》的描述，确实晦涩难懂了一些，但是戴上虚拟现实头盔，走进这家咖啡馆的时候，一切就都明朗了。一幅平面的画卷，被虚拟现实变成了完整的空间，让画中的人也活了起来。走入其中，与梵高画中的人物面对面，在印象派风格的灯光下四处打望，体会梵高画里空间与空间斗争而产生的压迫感。这种置身于画中的感受，是一种前所未有的感觉。
 
《夜晚的咖啡馆》是梵高的著名画作之一。要欣赏这样一幅名画，能有机会亲眼见到就是非常难得的，大多数人还是只能看到照片。但是有了虚拟现实，有了unity 引擎，就能直接从观画变成了画中人。
 
这段漫游体验里面还在钢琴上摆放了梵高的另外一幅名作《十五朵向日葵》，也让人惊喜万分。如果开发者们，做出更多这样的漫游体验，那么普通的人们对于艺术作品的认识，对于名人名画的认知将会更近一步。

2015.10.13  by  Oculus DK2

最后 我们下一个 VR 游戏的评测界面见！！

23369645.review: Fantastic. Really well done, lots of nice touces. “I put my heart and soul into my work, and I have lost my mind in the process.”

40292767.review:
Interestng idea - too short to be worth a download.

You start in one of my favorite Van Gogh paintings and are encouraged to look around.  It's a reasonable fascimile, but very little to do - no interactions and other than a few slightly scripted moments (Van Gogh gets out of his chair and looks out the window)

This could be a wonderful way to maybe teach about the painter - maybe being able to move around in his world, learn about his brother and how the people of his town treated him, his struggles with mental illness, but it's not that.

40212897.review: I want more of this, so developers please "shut up and take my money". I'll be glad to pay for a longer and rather interactive version.

39942736.review: Thank you for this amazing experience! Highly recommended. It's a great idea giving life to paintings. Just tracking needs to be improved.

39859180.review: Unbelievable that this is free - download it at once! It’s a great way to demo VR, an imaginative use of the technology. To be fair, there’s not much content here… two rooms (and a spooky basement, if you can find it) that you teleport around and look at stuff. Van Gogh himself is in there, doing his thing, as well as several props/scenes inspired by his works. Thumbs up!
